aircraft.value: Falcon Prime - AC-8607-276 at Zone-3 Facility

defect_observed.value: Flap extension asymmetry. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.

root_cause.value: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment

findings.value: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel System component. Physical examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.

corrective_action.value: Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps

remarks_investigation.value: Detailed examination conducted. Corrective measures implemented.

remarks_design.value: Technical evaluation completed. Proposed preventive measures are appropriate and align with design intent. Date: 10/04/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia

remarks_quality.value: Dept. Quality assurance review completed. Recommend enhanced incoming inspection criteria for this component type. Date: 11/04/2023 Signature: Wg Cdr B.P. Gupta

remarks_user.value: (Project):(if applicable) Fleet experience reviewed. Similar occurrences noted on other platforms. Support fleet-wide inspection. Date: 13/04/2023 Signature: Eng. R.P. Singh

remarks_ordaqa.value: (Quality Aspects) Regulatory quality requirements verified. Proposed actions meet airworthiness standards. Recommend approval. Date: 14/04/2023 Signature: Dr. P.L. Mehta

remarks_cemilac.value: / RCMA (Design Aspects) From regulatory standpoint, investigation meets required standards. Approve proposed corrective actions. Date: 20/04/2023 Signature: Gp Capt V.S. Pillai

Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Mission Critical
b) Defect Observed: Flap extension asymmetry. Anomaly detected during routine inspection.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Corrosion due to moisture accumulation in sealed compartment
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fuel System component. Physical
examination revealed signs of wear and degradation.
c) Remedial Measures Revise maintenance procedure to include additional verification steps
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Implement condition-based monitoring system
d) Attributable Code: R - Lapses on the part of Repair Agency/Manufacturer
